definition: to think of oneself as terrific (idiom); arrogant
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.chinese: 他是一個自高自大的人。

sentences.english: Dogmatism is puppyish come to its full growth.
sentences.chinese: 教條主義是盲目自高自大的全副面目。

sentences.english: It jauntily, above oneself, just take the advantage of temporarily downwind stopped.
sentences.chinese: 它洋洋得意，自高自大，只不過趁一時順風罷了。

sentences.english: Now some are puffed up, as though I would not come to you.
sentences.chinese: 有些人自高自大，以爲我不到你們那裏去。

sentences.english: He could not bear that they should be so conceited.
sentences.chinese: 他受不了他們這樣自高自大。

sentences.english: All this she attributed to the prejudice and conceit of the archdeacon.
sentences.chinese: 她把這一切全歸咎於會吏長的偏見與自高自大。

sentences.english: My crime is that I was an egotist.
sentences.chinese: 我的罪行是，我是一個自高自大。

definition: the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
lit. Yelang thinks highly of itself (idiom)/fig. foolish conceit
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
